content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Give the final angle and final length after 6s of a Spring pendulum with spring equilibrium length=0.12m, initial length=0.24m, initial angle=80deg, mass=1kg, spring constant=120 N/m .  Please interact with https://www.wolframalpha.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to enter the full spring pendulum physics problem into the search input box to get a solution from WolframAlpha. The search input field is labeled [6].
Action: Type [6]; Spring pendulum, equilibrium length 0.12 m, initial length 0.24 m, initial angle 80 degrees, mass 1 kg, spring constant 120 N/m, find final angle and final length after 6 seconds
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.2
token: : Type [6]; Spring pendulum, equilibrium length 0.12 m, initial length 0.24 m, initial angle 80 degrees, mass 1 kg, spring constant 120 N/m, find final angle and final length after 6 seconds

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: WolframAlpha doesn't understand the full natural language query as entered. I should try rephrasing the input using more standard notation, possibly focusing on one aspect at a time (e.g., "spring pendulum equation of motion" or "spring pendulum displacement after 6 seconds with given parameters"). This can help the engine parse the problem.
Action: Type [7]; spring pendulum, mass 1 kg, spring constant 120 N/m, unstretched length 0.12 m, initial length 0.24 m, initial angle 80 degrees, find position after 6 seconds
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.25
token: : Type [7]; spring pendulum, mass 1 kg, spring constant 120 N/m, unstretched length 0.12 m, initial length 0.24 m, initial angle 80 degrees, find position after 6 seconds

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The query is still too complex or ambiguous for WolframAlpha to interpret properly. I should simplify further, possibly by asking only for the equation of motion for a spring pendulum, or splitting the problem into two simpler queries (e.g., "spring pendulum equation of motion" and then "solve spring pendulum with given parameters at t=6 seconds"). Let's start by asking for the "spring pendulum equation of motion".
Action: Type [7]; spring pendulum equation of motion
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.3
token: : Type [7]; spring pendulum equation of motion

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: WolframAlpha recognized the input as "spring pendulum equation" and may provide the general equation or further computational form below. I need to scroll down to see the full solution or provided equations, which might help in proceeding with the next step for specific initial conditions.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The computational input fields for spring pendulum parameters are now visible. The current values do not match the task requirements. I need to update the parameters with the given values: spring constant = 120 N/m, equilibrium length = 0.12 m, initial angle = 80 deg, initial length = 0.24 m, mass = 1 kg, time = 6 s.
Action: Type [1]; 120
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: It appears I have been redirected to the previous page due to entering a value in the input box. I need to return to the page with the spring pendulum computational inputs to continue updating the parameters as required.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Going back did not bring me back to the computational input fields. I need to scroll down to see if the computational input panel with the editable fields reappears below.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The input fields for the parameters are now visible. The first field is for the spring constant, which needs to be changed from 100 to 120 N/m as per the task requirements.
Action: Type [1]; 120
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The webpage has returned to the top, showing the search and navigation area, but I need to continue editing the other input fields for the spring pendulum parameters further below. I need to scroll down again to access the computational input area.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The spring constant has been updated to 120. The next parameter, spring equilibrium length, must be set to 0.12 m as per the task (currently it's 1 m).
Action: Type [2]; 0.12
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows the page has scrolled up to the top and is no longer on the computational input section. I need to return to the parameter inputs to continue entering the required values for the spring pendulum problem.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The next parameter to correct is the "initial angle from vertical," which currently shows 55°. The required value is 80° as per the problem statement.
Action: Type [3]; 80
Confidence: 1
Completion: 0.7

Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
